key_points: Governor Cuomo announces COVID-19 vaccination mandate for all healthcare workers in New York State by September 27.
The mandate includes staff at hospitals, long-term care facilities, nursing homes, adult care, and other congregate care settings.
State Department of Health to issue Section 16 Orders for the development and implementation of mandatory vaccination policies.
Exceptions for the mandate are allowed for individuals with religious or medical reasons.
Currently, 75% of hospital workers, 74% of adult care facility workers, and 68% of nursing home workers in New York State are vaccinated.
Governor Cuomo urges private businesses to implement vaccinated-only policies and school districts to mandate vaccinations.
A third COVID-19 vaccine dose is authorized for New Yorkers with compromised immune systems, following CDC recommendations.
CDC recommends additional dose for people with severe immunocompromised conditions, including those receiving cancer treatment and organ transplants.
New Yorkers should consult their healthcare provider about the appropriateness of an additional vaccine dose.
The vaccination mandate aims to reduce the spread of COVID-19 and the Delta variant, following scientific guidance and data.
spokespersons: Dr. Howard Zucker (New York State Health Commissioner)
